intro: Stenomesson imasumacc, commonly known as the Sierra Madre dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant produces yellow ray flowers surrounded by a disk of smaller florets, typical of the family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. Its botanical features make it well adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures.
